name: K+K Hotel Maria Theresia

reviews.title: going to congress in Vienna
reviews.text: I am writing this review for those of us who come to Vienna for going to a congress and wonder how his hotel measures up. This is something I myself had difficulty finding relevant material about. This was my second visit to Vienna and I had already seen all the best tourist sights.

reviews.title: If only the exchange rate was as good as this hotel
reviews.text: This hotel is situated close to most sight seeing locations, and in his regard it must be very friendly for those who are tourists. This should explain the high rating this hotel has received. I do not mean that this hotel is bad. Quite the contrary, it is very good but not deserving the nest highest score, unless all other hotels in Vienna are much worse. If you want to go to the congress you take the subway from Volksteater which is 2 minute walk from the hotel. You have to change your line if you wish to go congress center, but the increased time spent is negligible.

reviews.title: You will enjoy a stay at the K+K!
reviews.text: As you enter the hotel you have nine steps and no doorman to greet you. There is no ramp and you have to carry the luggage up the stairs. If you problems with your back, you should go to the reception and ask for help. Also if you have some kind of handicap or have heavy baby strollers you probably should consider this.

reviews.title: Very high quality and value for money
reviews.text: My room was for single occupancy but I noticed that the amenities were for two people the day I arrived. The room was very small, but enough. I had no direct light from outside. In fact I think some light came in indirectly from somewhere else into my window. For instance, I had no way of knowing when it was raining.

reviews.title: Good hotel in good location.
reviews.text: Speaking of rain, the hotel provides for umbrellas close to entrance doors.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is conveniently located, just behind the Museum Quarter, for access to the RIngstrasse and many of Vienna's attractions. We stayed for 4 days as a couple on a winter city break. There is a Christmas market in the streets behind, and two others within easy walking distance.
reviews.title: Good location; excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel decor is modern and the rooms well appointed. The hotel is on a quiet street, so no traffic noise. Service was extremely good - reception were always efficient, friendly and informative. The restaurant staff were similarly efficient, and the breakfast spread was extensive.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a quiet location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, it formed an excellent base for the 4 days we were there.
reviews.title: 5 stars in service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We made a decision to stay in K+K hotel in Vienna based on our previous excellent experience in the hotel from the same chain in Prag. We were a group of 12 people.
reviews.title: Good Hotel with really Excellent Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Breakfast : good selection of hot and cold buffet incl. sparkling wine. We would have appreciated to have the opportunity to have breakfast till noon on Sunday (12:00) like at K+K in Prag. At 11:05, the staff is alreday cleaning all the place and at 11:10 you are outside.
reviews.title: Everything one looks for in a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel is a clean ,well organised hotel with no serious frills.You certainly get what you pay for.The hotel is 500m from the Volktheater underground station and this proved invaluable throughout our stay. The hotel breakfast is excelent with nothing spared ,even the sparkling wine each morning if you up for it.
reviews.title: Great Location &Great Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good points stated above
reviews.title: Warm and comfortable rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bad Points were slightly quiet and everyone seemed to smoke
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently got home from K+K Maria Theresia last weekend. Although it was snowing heavily with chilly winds, we were thankful that the hotel rooms were warm and cosy. The rooms are spacious and we were surprised to find that they have heated toilet floors which was excellent!
reviews.title: Met all our expectations

likes.liked: — Comfort of the rooms and the pleasantness of the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is superb with an excellent variety and good service. Furthermore, it is open from 6.30-11am which gives us a bit more time to lie in so that we don't have to rush for breakfast.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We booked this hotel for a week's stay in Vienna and were glad we did. It is on a quiet side street next door to the Museum Quarter. The Hofburg palace is only a 15 minute walk. Shops, restaurants and the subway are within a 5 minute walk. We arrived at 11 a.m. after an overseas flight. As soon as we got out of the taxi, a bellhop was right there to take our luggage for us. Our room was ready right away. It was on the top floor (6) overlooking the museums. It was not huge but spacious enough. What we liked were the little touches - heated bathroom floor, fluffy towels, and 3 shelves built into the bathroom wall for our toiletries. Also appreciated having a safe in our room to store our valuables. Free wifi. Wonderful buffet breakfast with huge selection. Staff was efficient, polite & spoke good English. We ate a couple of nights at bar at the hotel. There is a small menu to chose from - very good food, especially the apple strudel. If I could think of anything negative it would be the fact that the pillows are down filled and are very soft. I am used to a firm pillow and did not find the pillows comfortable. This is, however, a very minor criticism. All in all, we loved staying at this hotel and would highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Hotel within easy walking distance to most sights in Vienna. About 20 min from Stefansdom and 15 min from Opera House. Breakfast was very nice. Buffet with hot and cold selection. The staff were very nice, friendly and helpful and spoke excellent English. The first night we were put in room with tiled floor in hall. This was extremely noisy, could hear cleaning carts and high heels going by, we were able to change rooms for rest if stay and given a choice of rooms to choose from. WiFi access. It is very convenient for museums, shopping (mariahilferstrasse) and spittelberg market. Trams and underground are 2 blocks away.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We managed to walk here from the main train station, a bit of a walk, but very safe, easy to get to. Arrived early morning and to our surprise our room was ready, great to be able to get ready for the day. Great staff, recommended all the restaurants we dined at. Nice location, easy to walk to Imperial Palace, State Opera House, St Stephens, and quite near the underground station for easy access to Schonbrunn. Wonderful breakfast included in our rate, many items on buffet, including mimosas. Would stay again and recommend.
reviews.title: Very nice, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We made a decision to stay in K+K hotel in Vienna based on our previous excellent experience in the hotel from the same chain in Budapest. We were really impressed with the level of standard and service - from the quality of room, cleanliness, variety of buffet breakfast to helpful and polite staff. The position of the hotel is brilliant: 300 meters away from Museum Quarter and a walking distance from all the major city's attractions. It is located in a quiet street which allows one to rest after a full day of walking around Vienna. The hotel has its own garage which has to be paid additionally, but it is a usual thing in Vienna (you are lucky to have a parking place at all). All in all, a real recommendation for the K+K hotel chain – we will continue to stay in their facilities in European cities…
reviews.title: A quiet beautiful place in the center of the imperial city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was really friendly with great attentive staff. We had an excellent spacious room, super comfertable bed and fantastic breakfast. The location is really excellent for site seeing, Opera and Concert Hall. All the key attractions are an easy walk. I don't think there is anything I could fault!
reviews.title: Great Weekend in Vienna
Excellent hotel in a good location
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights and found it to be quite a treasure in a very convenient location close to the Museum Quarter, the Hofburg, Opera etc.

reviews.title: Nice location but no character.
reviews.text: The staff were all very helpful, attentive and friendly and recognised us and our room number each time we entered, despite the hotel being fairly full.

reviews.title: Ideal
reviews.text: The breakfast was exceptional with a vast range of fruit, breads, cold meats, cooked items as well as sparkling wine on offer!

reviews.title: Excellent hotel.
reviews.text: The rooms were well-equipped and comfortable and free internet was available just off the lobby.

reviews.title: Really impressed with the K&K
reviews.text: There were quite a number of interesting and reasonably-priced restaurants and bars very close to the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: K+K Maria Theresia is a superb no-frills no-fuss 3-4 star hotel. Nothing to rant and rave about but nothing particularly objectionable either. We had a very quiet street-facing room on the 6-th floor with beautiful views. Our king sized bed was comfy, bed linen and towels were topnotch, and bathroom nice, new and squeaky clean. The breakfast is excellent by European standards, definitely worth having if it comes with the room rate. I had my doubts over the location, but it was great! The neighborhood has some great eateries and cafes, little shops and art galleries, and the best Christmas market in our opinion.
reviews.title: You really can’t go wrong with the K+K Maria Theresia.

likes.disliked: — Sloppy housekeeping on our last day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing that holds me back from giving Maria Theresia a 5 is that housekeeping standards dropped significantly on our last day: bathroom amenities were not replenished, bed was really badly made (if made at all for that matter), and face towels were dumped on the counter as opposed to being nicely-rolled as on previous days. It made us feel that it was time to leave.
reviews.title: New Year in Vienna

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, reservation and front desk were very professional - all my pre-arrival emails and questions were answered instantly, check-in was smooth and efficient, and we were given a choice of rooms available.
reviews.title: Lovely, central hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An excellent choice overall. In fact, for such a pricey city, this hotel seemed to be comparatively inexpensive.
reviews.title: Nice experience, but could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 5 nights over the New Year period after spending 2 nights in Salzburg.
reviews.title: Brilliant K&K

likes.liked: — Breakfast and the lovely clean rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Booked a room at the K+K Hotel Maria Theresia after reading reviews on another travel site. We received a nice discount, metro passes, guide book, and tour bus tickets as part of our package. Although my requested room wasn't available, the given room was perfect for us. The bathroom has great storage and gives two people plenty of space for toiletries. The hotel is ideally located for touring museums, exploring the great local restaurants, and walking into the center. Breakfast is very well done and stocked until the end of service. The staff will assist with any special requests. Would return for another weekend stay.
reviews.title: Ideal location for a long-weekend of sight-seeing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel few times and must say I love K&K hotels very much. This one is near down town, with nice and clean rooms and very, very nice breakfast. Staff is always helpful and must say this one is my type of hotel for both private and business trips.
reviews.title: Great little hotel for business and city break
Our "Home" in Vienna since 1995
reviews.text: We live in California and our business and family brings us to Vienna twice a year. After a couple of years staying at some of the luxury Hotels like Hotel Bristol, Sacher and the Ana Grand Hotel we discovered the K&K Maria Theresia in the Kirchberggasse while visiting the famous Spittelberg Christmas Markets. Ever since, the hotel is our 'home away from home'. The entire team is committed to make your visit enjoyable. From the front desk staff to the servers at breakfast (ah, breakfast has always a well presented, delicious and plentiful selection) to the valet and housekeeping, everyone is kind, friendly and eager to please. Our room regularly is one on the 6th floor. Not huge in size, it makes up for it with a fantastic view, a panorama of Vienna's Ringstrasse with its glorious architecture. We also love the hotel location, close to the U-Bahn, a short 10 Minute walk to the Ring and town down. There are lots of little art shops and good neighborhood restaurants in the area. Indeed we are already looking forward to our next stay, coming November! In short, K&K is a special place, we highly recommend it to be also your hotel choice when next in Vienna, what ever the reason of your visit, business or pleasure.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed here for four nights at the end of September on a British Airways city break and I'd do it again like a shot. The location for me was perfect : close to the Underground; within walking distance of the central area of Vienna (in particular the Museum Quarter) and near the Mariahilfer Strasse for shopping etc. Yet the hotel was completely quiet in the evenings. Indeed the entrance is in a mews, not a street.
reviews.title: Ideal for a city break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel caters for business and pleasure visitors with equal ease. The rooms are first class and generally quiet (unless a hippopotomus is staying in the next room - only for one night in my case thank goodness) though don't expect much of a view. There's a decent safe, TV and the bathroom is exactly of the standard you'd expect. The public areas are well appointed and pleasant, and the food is very good. The staff: be they at check in, the restaurant, the bar or maintaining the room were all perfect.
reviews.title: Would stay again...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: I was very pleasantly surprised by the hotel. The location was near the Ringstrasse, in a quiet pleasant area. It was convenient to museums, public transportation, restaurants and shopping. The room was clean and large, with a great view. The staff was very helpful and spoke excellent English. Wifi coverage was excellent. Breakfast buffet was outstanding.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend to friends and would be happy to stay here again.
reviews.title: Central

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly welcome and helpful reception staff.Room on 4th floor but still a bit noisey. Club opposite and cobbles.Good room with comfortable beds. Good variety buffet breakfast (cooked and Continental). Location in Museum Quarter only a short walk from most tourist items.
reviews.title: Perfect spot in Vienna

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights here in Oct 2013. Excellent location on a side street and quiet for such a central location, friendly staff, clean room & bath, comfortable bed, breakfast buffet offering something for everyone's taste. We will definately use K+K chain of hotels in other cities too.
reviews.title: Great but could do better on some details

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The airline left some baggage behind and of course mine was one of them. The staff was very helpful making phone calls for me to see when it would be delivered at the hotel and offered comforting words at a stressful moment.
reviews.title: I will stay here again :)

description: In the Bohemian district of Spittelberg – directly in the centre of Vienna and yet still a quiet location – you will find the urbane and intimate K+K Hotel Maria Theresia. Distinguished ambiance, individual service and Austrian hospitality set our luxury hotel in Vienna apart. The exquisite living quarters as well as the fresh and modern atmosphere make your stay at the Vienna K+K Hotel Maria Theresia especially enjoyable. Free WiFi in all guest rooms and public area. Free access to the Internet Lounge (PCs, printer and international newspapers). Free access to the Wellness Area with gym and sauna. Complimentary coffee and tea making facilities in the rooms.
